intro: Pedicularis gracilis subsp. sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese slender lousewort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has slender, hairy stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with two lips and a spur that extends downward. It is valued in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
